text: ohhh thank you it works now
hello team I want to get custom sales data from mobile number , how can I do it?
Hi, Simon, do you perhaps know of anyone that could assist on this issue, unfortunately it still not resolved.

Hello, regarding this permission change for OAuth apps: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/new-permission-requirements-for-installing-public-apps>

• Could you share what the experience would be for a user that does not have the correct permissions? Is it an error page? Will you call the OAuth callback URL with a failure response? Unsure if there is a new scenario we need to handle in our app and less than two weeks notice on the changes.
• How would you recommend that — from inside our own marketplace app — we determine if a user has the permission to grant us new scopes? If we add a new feature that requires additional scopes, we need to prompt them to re-install with the updated scopes but now it seems that much fewer HS accounts will be able to do that?

hi team, when creating a contact via API is there any way to limit the output so that my return request doesn't return all the details of a contact? I only need the contact ID as output
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

Why would HubSpot not understand its own date format?

I got these date stamps from the API and tried importing them as another field in the HubSpot import via the GUI…
<@U038DUUV3GE> I’ve seen this happen when exporting files from Excel. It might change date/time output to something different.
It doesn’t like the `T` or `Z` that the API provides in datetime fields…
I removed all T’s and Z’s and it imported :disappointed:
Did you use the import API endpoint?
No I had to shift the data around so I just imported as a CSV in the HubSpot interface
Seems silly it can’t take the datetime that its own API spits out though.
Any possible way to assign a Conversation Thread to a user or team via API?
